question: In 2009, a man in Florida was arrested for riding a lawnmower while drunk. He told police he was on his way to ___.
William Shatner raised $25,000 for Habitat for Humanity by selling his ___.
In Japan, there is a museum dedicated entirely to ___.
A town in New Mexico named ___ is the only town in the US where you can mail a letter with their special postmark during the holiday season.
In 2012, a Norwegian boy escaped from wolves by playing a ___ on his phone.
The hashtag symbol (#) is technically called a ___.
Before becoming a famous actor, Danny DeVito worked as a ___ in his sister's salon.
In Switzerland, it is illegal to own just one ___ because they get lonely.
NASA once accidentally erased the original recordings of the ___ and had to use TV broadcast copies.
The longest hiccuping spree lasted 68 years and was suffered by a man named ___.
The inventor of the Pringles can, Fredric Baur, requested that when he died, his ashes be buried in a ___.
Oxford University is older than the ___.
In 1932, Australia lost a war against ___.
Cleopatra lived closer in time to the ___ than to the construction of the Great Pyramid.
The shortest war in history lasted only 38 minutes and was between Britain and ___.
A group of flamingos is called a ___.
In 2008, a dog in China was trained to walk on its ___ legs after losing its front legs.
The original name for the search engine Google was ___.
Before alarm clocks were invented, people in England hired ___ to wake them up in the morning.
In 2016, someone paid $10,000 at an auction for a ___ shaped like a chicken nugget that resembled a famous figure.
solution: chicken nugget shaped like George Washington

question: Honey never ___. Archaeologists have found 3000-year-old honey in Egyptian tombs that was still perfectly good.
The national animal of Scotland is the ___.
There are more possible iterations of a game of chess than there are ___ in the observable universe.
In 2015, a man legally changed his name to ___ to protest against the UK government.
Nintendo originally started as a company that made ___.
The inventor of the fire hydrant is unknown because the patent was destroyed in a ___.
In medieval England, animals could be put on ___ and were actually given lawyers.
The longest English word without a vowel is ___.
Astronaut Buzz Aldrin's mother's maiden name was ___.
A ___ is the only animal that can't jump.
Samsung's first product was ___.
In 2006, a woman sued ___ for $1.7 million because their product didn't match the advertisement.
The dot over the letters 'i' and 'j' is called a ___.
The first item ever sold on eBay was a ___.
In 1994, a prisoner in West Virginia tried to escape by covering himself in ___.
Coca-Cola was originally ___ colored, not brown.
The fear of long words is ironically called ___.
The youngest pope in history was approximately ___ years old when he took office.
In 2014, a man in India set a world record by eating ___ ghost peppers in two minutes.
The Great Wall of China was held together with a mortar made of ___.
A jiffy is an actual unit of time equal to ___.
The first person convicted of speeding was going ___ mph.
In ancient Rome, ___ was used as mouthwash.
The average person walks the equivalent of ___ times around the world in their lifetime.
In 2013, a pizza was delivered to the ___, making it the most expensive pizza delivery ever.
The world's oldest known joke is about ___.
IKEA's Billy bookcase is so popular that one is sold every ___.
Bananas are technically classified as ___.
The inventor of the AK-47 later said he wished he had invented ___ instead.
In 2009, the country of ___ temporarily disappeared from Google Maps due to a glitch.
